result.execSummary:
The defendant Bonnie K Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the Fine.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars unless in furtherance of her employment, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.    Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Good Time and Huber Privileges granted.  Defendant is granted one day of prior time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Return of Search Warrant, Search Warrant (phone), Affidavit in Support of OWI Search Warrant, Return of Operating While Impaired Warrant

Case Called @ 1:25 PM:  Defendant Bonnie K. Morris in Court, appearing pro se via video conference.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant does not wish counsel.  Case formally called for Court Reporter services.  Court entertains waiver of personal appearance today.  Def agrees to participate via video.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of her personal appearance today.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant formally waives counsel.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of counsel.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 (OWI):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 FTI IID DRI.  ADA argues as to sentencing recommendation.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  Def requests probation sentence be imposed.  The Court:  28 days WCJ - I/S (GT, Huber and 1 day TS credit) - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  5 days WCJ, Huber, GT and 1 day TS credit.  Commence sentence by no later than 3/1/15 @ 8:00 PM; $1442.00 plus $42.50 Blood Draw Cost, fine includes DNA Surcharge; 13 mos DL Rev; OWI Assessment prior to relicensing occurs; IID for 13 mos from today's date.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru; Ab Sob, Bar Prohibition, Not to possess any impairing substances unless prescribed; Prohibited from being on the premises of any bar unless in furtherance of her employment.  PQ and ARIPR forwarded via fax by to WCJ.  Any additional citations that may be issued will be dismissed prejudicially.  Warrant transcript will not have to be transcribed at this time due to plea, to be retained in file however.
